alert.note: Alert for Newton; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 10:02PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NEWTON AND SOUTHEASTERN SCOTT COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM CST... At 1002 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake, or 8 miles west of Newton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Newton, Lawrence, and Roberts around 1010 PM CST. Decatur and Hickory around 1020 PM CST. Chunky around 1030 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for central and east central Mississippi.
